column4: i installed 7zip but i dont see it nowhere in applications sections nor if i type in 7zip in terminal do i get anything any ideas?
use the package manager tools to see what files it installed.. I forget its command line  comand names also. :)
thats one tool that can do it.. or the command line tools can.. or  if you are using kde, adept can do it..
im using gnome ima see brb
i have p7zip-full in synaptic package manager working
fire up synaptic, search for the package, check its properties. it should show what files it isntalled..  the commands would be the ones installed to the bin dirs.
okay i see the command is 7za and i guess 7z because i see usr/bin7z and usr/bin/7za im a noobie i typed it in in terminal
and it worked fine.  but wow is there a gui?
there are archive tools/frontends that use  the 7zip stuff if found I belive.. I never use them
i could get use to the commandline but i would love to just have a gui for easy and faster access and work
i tend to use 'unp' to unpack archives.. and thats about it. i arely make them
okay thank you i learned something new today htough thanks
would u say unp is one of the best archiving files ou there? im just trying to use a program that compresses the best
its an UNARCHIVING tool. :) its   unp whateverarchive  (and it normally figures out the right command to unpack the archive)
okay cool thank u thats good to know too
thanks i appreciate the help you gave me today
hey im so stupid i didnt see that when you right click the file u want compressed that the archive manager has an extension for .7z but tahnks either way i didnt realize it
